level.heading: COMMERCIAL PERMIT PARKING; ANNUAL PASS (§ 18-2428) There is established a commercial permit parking (CPP) annual pass to provideommercial motor vehicle owners the option to purchase an annual parking passor a commercial motor vehicle to park in loading zones or at curbside parkingpaces instead of paying for parking at the meter in those zones. A commercial motor vehicle owner or company shall complete an application, to berovided by DDOT, including identifying information on each vehicle to beegistered for a CPP annual pass. DDOT shall provide a decal to a participating commercial motor vehicle owner toffix to each commercial motor vehicle in the owner’s fleet that isarticipating in the CPP annual pass program. The commercial parking permit decal shall display the following information: A serial number or other identifying mark; and The expiration date, which shall specify the last day that the permit for theommercial motor vehicle is effective. Except as provided in § 2428.6, a participating company shall affix a validarking decal provided by DDOT on each commercial motor vehicle in theompany’s fleet that is participating in the CPP program on the lower rightand corner of the passenger side window. A company that purchases seventy-five (75) permits may, subject to approval byDOT, use their company logo instead of the decal. The CPP annual pass shall allow for parking at designated loading zones duringimes specified in those zones; provided, that if no time is specified, theoading zone shall be in effect between 7:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m., or in a meteredurbside zone during off-peak hours of 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and when meternforcement is not in effect, as posted on the signs and meters in the parkingone; provided further, that such parking is otherwise consistent with therovisions of § 2402. Notwithstanding § 2404.5, a commercial motor vehicle may park outside a loadingone between the hours of 10:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m. with a valid annual pass ift occupies no more than two (2) metered spaces or no more than forty feet (40t.) within a parking zone serviced by a multi-space meter.
